blocks.text: The PennTek TR-25 is a dual-band CW QRP transceiver covering 40m and 20m bands. It provides 5W output power and is designed for portable field operations.
Power on the radio using the main power switch. The display shows frequency, band, and operating status. Use the main VFO knob for tuning.
Band switching between 40m and 20m is performed via the band select button. The radio automatically recalls the last frequency used on each band.
The TR-25 provides RIT (Receiver Incremental Tuning) for fine-tuning the receive frequency without affecting transmit frequency, useful for working split operations.
Ensure antenna SWR is below 2:1 for full power output. The radio includes SWR protection that reduces power with mismatched antennas.
Access the menu by pressing and holding the MENU button. Scroll through options with the main tuning knob and select with MENU.

blocks.name: Keyer Speed
blocks.description: Sets internal keyer speed from 5-35 WPM

blocks.name: Sidetone Pitch
blocks.description: Adjusts CW sidetone frequency from 400-800 Hz

blocks.name: Keyer Mode
blocks.description: Selects Straight Key, Iambic A, or Iambic B

blocks.text: The TR-25 includes a full-featured internal iambic keyer with speed adjustable from 5-35 WPM. Both Iambic A and Iambic B modes are supported.
Connect a paddle to the 3.5mm keyer jack. Standard wiring: tip = dit, ring = dah, sleeve = ground. Use the Paddle Swap menu option to reverse if needed.
For straight key operation, set the keyer mode to 'Straight Key' in Menu 04. The radio will then key directly from the tip contact.
Sidetone provides audio feedback during keying. Adjust pitch and volume to your preference. The sidetone is output through both the speaker and headphone jack.
PennTek radios are known for clean keying characteristics. The TR-25 provides shaped keying to minimize key clicks.
The TR-25 features a crystal ladder filter providing approximately 500 Hz bandwidth, well-suited for CW operation in typical amateur band conditions.
The receiver uses a traditional superheterodyne design optimized for sensitivity and selectivity in CW operation.
AGC (Automatic Gain Control) helps maintain consistent audio levels when signal strengths vary.
For very crowded band conditions, consider adding an external audio filter to further narrow the passband.
The TR-25 operates from 9-14V DC input through a standard 2.1mm barrel connector (center positive). Nominal operation is at 12-13.8V.
Current consumption is approximately 50mA on receive and up to 1.5A during transmit at full power. Total power consumption makes it suitable for battery operation.
A 3S LiPo (11.1V nominal) or 3S LiFePO4 (9.9V nominal) battery pack provides excellent portable power. Internal protection circuits prevent damage from low voltage conditions.
Do not exceed 14V input voltage. Do not reverse polarity - this may cause permanent damage.
PennTek recommends a 2000mAh battery minimum for extended portable operations.
The TR-25 does not include an internal antenna tuner. Use a resonant antenna or external ATU for best results.
For dual-band operation, a trapped dipole or linked dipole antenna provides good performance without needing a tuner.
When using a random wire or non-resonant antenna, a small external ATU such as the Elecraft T1 is recommended.
The radio's SWR protection will reduce power if SWR exceeds safe levels. Always verify antenna match before operating at full power.
No power on: Verify DC voltage is 9-14V. Check polarity (center positive). Inspect power cable and connector for damage.
No or low RF output: Check antenna connection and SWR. High SWR triggers power foldback. Verify band selection matches antenna.
Keyer issues: Verify paddle wiring (tip=dit, ring=dah). Check keyer mode setting. Try Paddle Swap if dit/dah are reversed.
Poor receive sensitivity: Check antenna connections. Verify RIT is not offsetting receive frequency significantly. Try different antenna.
Display problems: Adjust brightness setting. In cold weather, LCD may respond slowly - allow warmup time.
